an6.6:1.1: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with six factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
an6.6:1.3: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches. And it’s strong.
an6.6:1.4: A fine royal thoroughbred with these six factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
an6.6:2.1: In the same way, a mendicant with six qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
an6.6:2.3: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.
an6.6:2.4: A mendicant with these six qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”
